review_blob: I have always enjoyed this beer. I think it is one of the best widely abailable stouts. I always drink this right out of the bottle. Has a real dark chocolate taste with a bitter finish. I generally do not like stouts, but this one is always tasty and relatively light.

Smells like beer in a nice way. Has that classic budweiser look in the glass. I went to the cigar city taste room and they were testing two different lagers to take over for the hotter than helles lager. If this is the replacement I dont like it as much. It isnt bad though. Probably the lightest beer i have had from cigar city. Not bad, but definitely not on par with some of the other amazing cigar city beers.

Good beer. Pours a reddish amber. Looks great in a pint glass. Thin head that doesnt last long. Defintely a bold beer. Strong bitter taste right off the bat with a nice bitter finish. Like i said. This is a good beer. Not great but good. Couldnt see myself drink more than one or two of these in a sitting.

Average beer. I think it looks amazing out of the can. It might be one of the best looking beers ive had. Reminds of the way Boddingtons pours into the glass. Tastes below average. Smells like nothing. It isnt an IPA. My guess is that they slapped IPA on the can for marketing purposes. That said, it isnt that bad. Totally drinkable but i probably wouldnt buy it again. Worth buying once for the pour - it really is a beautiful pour.

This is the best beer i have ever had. Pours a pretty golden caramel color with a nice fluffy head. The head stick with the beer untul the last sip. Tastes hoppy with a lot of citrus. Has a delicious bitter aftertaste that will have you craving another pint. I highly recommend finding Jai Alai on tap if you are in Tampa. Otherwise a can will work just fine. I find that a lot of the great IPAs out there are tough to drink beyond one or two, but i end up drinking the whole sixer with Jai Alai. Cheers.
beer_name: Cigar City Jai Alai India Pale Ale
